channel.title: PI commands rep++
channel.description:
how can i make a PI command list so ppl can see their commands :S
i tryed a delta one but it dont work ofcourse so maybe some1 can convert the deta on to a PI or tell me how to make a PI one i will rep++

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @s_w_3_3_t1 s w 3 3 t1
item.description:
@s_w_3_3_t1 wrote:

in my command i added it does show that! if you can not see the “show interface” then something it wrong with your comp ;p

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Id suggest having a menu (like the quests show) to show all the commands.

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @s_w_3_3_t1 s w 3 3 t1
item.description:
@s_w_3_3_t1 wrote:

add this to your commands.java folder

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“rules”)) {
c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
c.flushOutStream();
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8144);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8147);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8148);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8149);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8150);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8151);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8152);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8153);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text", 8154);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8155);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8156);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8157);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8158);
c.getPA().sendFrame126("~text~", 8159);
}

add your rules into where it says “~text~”

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Have you even made a public void commandsMenu()?

I’m not saying this is the correct way, but if you create the void in PersonalAssisstant.java, then you’d have to use getPA().yourCommandVoidHere();

Get the concept?

Edit: Read this to get a better understanding of PI: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,466517.0/topicseen.html

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:6, topic:371446”]That’s the tacky way of doing it. Best to bring up an interface.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { getPA().commandsMenu(); }

is better.[/quote]

all gives errors and Mendorphins the error comes by getPa().commandsMenu(); same with c.getPa().commandsMenu();

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

That’s the tacky way of doing it. Best to bring up an interface.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) { getPA().commandsMenu(); }

		[code]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("commands")) {
			c.sendMessage("Commands go here");
		}[/code]

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Like I said, try using getPA().showInterface(8134);
or c.getPA().showInterface(8134);

That’s all I’m going to say, you can do it.

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands rep++
item.dc:creator: @oldschool-scape oldschool-scape
item.description:
@oldschool-scape wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:2, topic:371446”]Once you have declared the void have you tried “c.getPA()” (for anything outside of the Client.java) and/or “getPA()” if it’s in the Client.java.

Find an already made void for a “::menu” and then base it off of this. You can do it. ;)[/quote]

it aint got anything of that no ::rules or ::menu

so u can convert the commandlist for me ( this is just an example but if yo convert it i can see what u did so i can learn it ;] )

[code]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“commands”) && (playerRights >= 0)) {
String name = command.substring(5);
sendQuest("@gre@Aaaightscape commands by King", 8144); //Title
clearQuestInterface();
sendQuest("@blu@Players: ::chaos ::home ::commands ::mycity ::getcity", 8147);
sendQuest("::bandos,::pure,::info,staffnotice,::yell ::herblore,", 8148);
sendQuest("::rules ,::charges,::usedfs,::mypos ::changepassword ::rc", 8149);
sendQuest("::players ::forums ::playermenu ::cashzone ::empty ::smith", 8150);
sendQuest("::wc1 ::wc2 ::moleclear ::thief ::mining ::mining2 “, 8151);
sendQuest(”@whi@ MEMBER COMMANDs", 8152);
sendQuest("::memberzone", 8153);
sendQuest("@red@MOD commands", 8154);
sendQuest("::runes ::prayer ::book ::staffzone ::kick", 8155);
sendQuest("::unmute ::mute ::jail ::unjail ::xteleto", 8156);
sendQuest("::bank", 8157);
sendQuest("@gre@ admin commands", 8158);
sendQuest("::spec ::spirit ::giveitem ::staffchill ::pnpc", 8159);
sendQuest(“unpc ::npc ::emote ::message ::master”, 8160);
sendQuest(“switch ::lunar ::item ::special ::tele”, 8161);
sendQuest("::ipmute ::copy ::pickup", 8162);
sendQuest("::npcreset ::master2 ::gfx ::xteletome", 8163);
sendQuestSomething(8143);
showInterface(8134);
flushOutStream();

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:

Once you have declared the void have you tried “c.getPA()” (for anything outside of the Client.java) and/or “getPA()” if it’s in the Client.java.

Find an already made void for a “::menu” and then base it off of this. You can do it.
